page.title: 09HOUSING AND OCCUPANCY
page.content: This area includes part of Hatfield Broad Oak and High Roding. There are 9 occupied farmhouses; 55 other houses - occupants divided almost evenly between farmworkers, local employed, commuters and retired people. Many of the houses are of{historic interest. In {Gt. Canfield}:- 3 are 15C., 9 are 16C. and 10 are 17C. others l8C. and l9C. 9 properties are thatched, 3 have early 17C. wrought iron casement windows with early leaded glass. Very little {new building} has been allowed in the area which is protected {Green Belt. }Proximity to Stansted Airport, given Government approval in 1985 to expand will undoubtedly alter the blance and volume of housing in this area. Gt. Canfield is Phase 4 of {projected development}for housing.
